11111112.content:
Lord Vader was waiting when Emperor Palpatine entered the room. "What is it, my apprentice?" he asked the tall figure, sitting down.

"My master, I wish to search the records of the Jedi for any clues which might provide the whereabouts of any Jedi who survived Order 66 or for any connections that may have existed between the Jedi and the senators. I am requesting access to the Jedi temple," the man told him.

Vader heard the other Sith draw in a sharp breath and sensed his displeasure. The anger was not directed at him, however.

"What is it, master?" he asked.

"Kenobi completely shut down the computer system of the Temple when he left," Darth Sidious said quietly. "There is absolutely no way to reactivate it to reach the records for anyone who does not know the exact activation code." He lifted his hooded face and looked at his apprentice. "I'm afraid any attempt to do so on your part would be futile, Lord Vader."

Vader felt his own anger rising. Kenobi! was all he could think. His resolution to hunt down his former master hardened even further, if that were possible.

"That is most unfortunate," he said in as calm a voice as he could manage. He bowed and stalked out of the room.

He headed for the main hangar of the Imperial Palace. The building had fitted into that role quite nicely over the past two years since the formation of the empire, and apparently the inhabitants had as well. There was nothing to suggest that this building had once been part of the headquarters of a republic.

Now that he reached the hangar, he found that he was undecided as to why he had come here. He ordered his shuttle, nevertheless. When he boarded, he told the pilot to set a course for...
11111112.title: Searching the Jedi records

111111121.content:
The Alderaanian senator watched the Imperial shuttle landing on the platform outside. He recognized it all too well.

Darth Vader had come to pay a visit.

But what in the galaxy for?

His eyes flicked to the carpeted floor, where little Leia Organa sat playing with her dolls. Of course, the girl would most probably never know her true last name. Or her parentage. On one side, at least. Perhaps someday he would tell her about her mother, but he would carry the secret of her father to his grave.

And now her father was here, unexpectedly.

He always felt nervous when Leia and Vader were in the same room. It didn't happen often, but it still scared him, especially when he was there too. All the Sith lord had to do was probe his mind, and all was over. For him. And for Leia, most likely. At least, all over for her morality. They would train her in the dark side of the force.

The doors slid open and the man in question strode in. Leia looked at him with wide eyes, but stood and went to Organa's side. She already showed her talent for diplomacy at two years old, which was amazing. If Vader hadn't been in the room, Organa would have thought, "Just like her mother," but he didn't dare. Who knew what Vader read in his face.

"My lord," he greeted the other. "This is unexpected."

Darth Vader made no movement, but said, after a moment, "I am conducting a search for any surviving Jedi, and wished to assure myself of your cooperation, senator."

Organa kept his face expressionless. "I am an Imperial senator. Would I obstruct a mission of an imperial commander?"

Vader never took his eyes from his face. "Perhaps not," he said, his voice unreadable. Then he turned toward the door.
111111121.title: Alderaan. He would pay Bail Organa a visit.

1111111212.content:
Organa's heart almost stopped beating. What had the Sith sensed? Was there some resemblance Vader saw or felt between Leia and one of her parents?

Darth Vader studied the little girl standing unafraid by her father. It was unusual for children to show no nervousness around him, with his black mask and cloak and towering height. He knew he made a rather... impressive figure, to put it mildly. Kenobi had done this to him, made him seem half-droid to some. He - shall we say - discouraged such thinking, but he knew it still existed. He hated his former master for what he had done to him, but he didn't mind so much at times. His intimidating appearance could be very useful at times.

Not that his well-known tendency to use the force when he was angry didn't help or anything.

In any case, Senator Organa's little girl didn't seem intimidated. His interest was awakened by this fearless child.

"Senator Organa," he asked, "you have adopted a girl? She is clearly not your own."

Organa's throat constricted, but only for a second. If Vader sensed anything like fear, it would be all over. "She is the child of a friend. Both her parents are dead, so my wife and I adopted her." He looked down at Leia. Both dead. Well, they were.

Vader looked at her as well. She was strong in the force, he could sense that. Very strong. If these had been the days of the Republic, she would by now probably be a Jedi padawan. He crushed that thought. The Jedi had destroyed him, kept him from his full power and betrayed him. Especially the man whom he once regarded as a father. Obi-Wan Kenobi had turned Padme, his Padme, against him, and caused him to accidentally take her life.

He returned his attention to Organa, who had unconsciously placed a hand on the girl's shoulder. He nodded briefly and strode from the room. These thoughts, awakened by a little girl, were too painful.
1111111212.title: Memories

11112.content: "In order to understand the true power of a Sith Lord," Palpatine explained, "you must study the history of the Sith." </br> </br> Vader shifted impatiently, preparing himself for a long, dull history lesson. "As you wish," he said reluctantly. </br> </br> The Sith had come into existence two thousand years ago. A rebellious Jedi Knight founded the Order, one who understood from the beginning that the real power of the Force was that of the dark side. Seeking to gain approval from the Jedi Council about his beliefs in hope that they be embraced and become a part of a Jedi Knight's training, he called for a special meeting with Council. Sensing that these beliefs had consumed the young Jedi, the Council exiled him, and he departed the Order with hatred in his heart. </br> Not long after his exile, others who had ordained his beliefs as their own joined their mentor and created their own order, whose purpose was not to serve, but to dominate. This order was not last, however. Lust for power and dominion over fellow Sith caused the order to turn against itself. In the end, the Sith destroyed their leader, and then each other. Those clever enough to survive the civil war were quickly killed off by Jedi Knights. All of them died. </br> </br> All but one. </br> </br> The one Sith who had survived had adopted patience, cunning, stealth, and agility, all of which were taught to a Jedi Knight. Using these to his advantage, he was able to stand aside while the Sith destroyed themselves. He then went into hiding, and waited until it was believed that all the Sith were destroyed. Eventually, he came out of hiding. Growing old, he trained another to become a Master of the Dark Arts in his sted, teaching him the same techniques that had kept him alive during the Sith onslaught. Along with the concept that power denied was power wasted, he also told his apprentice that in order for the Sith to survive, it was vital that only two could exist at any one time. A Master and an Apprentice. Their war was with the Jedi, not with each other. </br> </br> Vader's eyes were opened. It all made sense now. Palpatine was the apprentice to Darth Plagueis. Having learned everything he could from his former master, Palpatine killed him to order to ensure the strength of the Sith was superior to that of the Jedi. It was Palpatine who created him, the prophesied Chosen One, due to his abundance of midichlorians to become his apprentice, Darth Vader. </br> </br> Vader exhaled with great satisfaction. One day he would learn all his master knew. He would learn how to keep the ones he cared about from dying, but even more than that, he would learn how to bring the ones he loved and missed so much back from the dead. He was, after all, the Chosen One. Someday, Padme would be with him again.
11112.title: A Profound History Lesson

Vader's ship, along with an army of stormtroopers, touched down on a dock on the planet Selab. The planet was completely covered with salt water, However the man made docking bays allowed visitors to take an elevator down to the bottom floor of the planet where many cities were located. Cities which very well might hide Jedi who had escaped Order 66. Normally visitors to Selab would be stripped of their weapons before entering the city, but since the rise of the empire...certain exceptions were made.

Vader, flanked by stormtroopers filed into different elevators, the troops had orders to search the four cities: Skiverrn, Killet, Alask, and Veven 3. And to arrest anyone who even looked suspicious to them. Vader was going to Veven 3 with squad of simple troops. He didn't suppose it would be very hard to weed out any surviving Jedi on this wet rock.

As Vader stepped out into the vastly populated city of Veven 3....He wasn't even tempted to marvel at it's beauty. He had left such trivial things behind him. He motioned for the troopers to follow him as several citizens cleared the streets. Soon there wasn't a sound to be heard on the ground level of Veven 3....Save for a wheezing noise. "I want every building in this city searched! You won't be resting until I have my Jedi! Now go!" Vader ordered his stormtroopers as they tore off down the streets, into alleyways, and into homes.

111211121.content:
During the Clone Wars, Kento Marek became acquainted with a fellow Jedi named Mallie. Unlike Kento, Mallie had no interest in seeking fame and glory as a warrior. Her sympathy for those who suffered throughout the conflict caused Marek to rethink his personal views. Despite their differences, the two developed a close relationship with each other, which eventually culminated into love an emotional attachment that was expressly forbidden by the long-standing tenets of the Jedi Order. In the midst of the galaxy-wide fighting, Kento and Mallie renounced their allegiance to the Order and married in secret. Due to their self-imposed exile, the two former Jedi Knights abandoned the war and went into hiding in order to start a new life together.

Their desertion saved their own lives when, upon the decree of Order 66, the clone troopers betrayed and murdered their Jedi officers on thousands of fronts all over the galaxy. The systematic genocide extended to ex-Jedi as well, thus turning Kento and Mallie into fugitives. Mallie became pregnant and gave birth to a son, Galen Marek. Shortly afterward, she was killed while trying to defend a group of Wookiees from Trandoshan slavers. Forced to raise their only child by himself, Kento and his son were still living on Kashyyyk when the Sith Lord Darth Vader launched a massive invasion on Kashyyyk. In this context the little Galen was ordered to go into hiding while his father struggled with the assailant Sith Lord Recognizing Vader's superior skills with the lightsaber, Marek used the Force to catch several TIE fighters in the sky and hurled them at Vader and succeeding in killim him with his lightsaber.
111211121.title: Kento Marek

Almost one year has passed now since the downfall of the Republic and the great Jedi purge. Despite some minor problems with small groups of rebels, Palpatine really has restored peace to the Republic. But one day, some highly regarded imperial officers were meeting in one of Coruscant´s many skycrapers. There were 10 officers gathering around a table, with one man as their leader, general Jiros, an ordinary man who was about 25 years old. He also was the one to start the meeting.
"Comrades, you all know why gathered here today. It is about time to start the final phase of our plans. But everything must work perfectly if Palpatine is to be destroyed."
He paused and looked into his fellow officers´ faces. They all seemed to be determined to fullfill their daring plans, and Jiros knew that he needed strong and firm comrades.
"First of all, we must get rid of Lord Vader. Without him, it will be easier for us to confront the Emperor."
"But Jiros, how are we gonna do that? How could we be able to kill Vader?" Cyrus, an imperial admiral, asked. Maybe he knew how this futile plan would end. No one ever survived an attempt to destroy Vader. And he had doubts that it would be different this time.

113.content:
The recently appointed Grand Moff Tarkin straightened his new uniform in a holo-mirror within his high-level apartment on Coruscant, a look of smug satisfaction written across his face.

Indeed, his elevation to such a level of power over his last few decades had impressed him - first as an little-known political advisor on Naboo, then a gradual rise under the watchful eyes of Palpatine, a man who had by circumstance possessed the same views of might and control. He'd lived through the Clone Wars as one of many of Palpatine's advisors, secretly aware of the pathetic Jedi Council's fate and the power his friend possessed. Wisely he had stood in the sidelines, onlying intervening when it suited him. And thus when the eradication of the Jedi had been completed, Tarkin received his postion of Governer of his home world Eriadu and its surrounding systems.

In the six years which had passed since the end of the Republic and the rise of the Galactic Empire, Tarkin had already proven himself and created more than a fearful reputation of his loyalty and respect towards his Emperor, to the point where only perhaps Palpatine's apprentice, Vader, understood his aims and ambitions so successfully.

Vader, yes. Tarkin paused in the fastening of his insigmas on his uniform to ponder the enigma of Vader. True, he alone knew the truth of the Sith Lord's real identity - the fallen Anakin Skywalker, last of a wasteful and foolish religion. Yes, the Jedi were extinct, and Vader and his master was all that was left of their decadent ways.

Completeing his outfit Tarkin reviewed a holo-crystal in his hand, displaying the image that only he and a few like-minded individuals were aware on - the ongoing construction of the Death Star. Tarkin had been assigned near-full responsibility on the update in its progress, not to mention the difficulties which proceeded making it secure from prying eyes and how to mantain a machine the size of a small moon.

But its long development would be worth it. Once the Death Star was completed, the Emperor would have little need for the Senate and all the political levers which sprang with it. Tarkin had already filled a report to Palpatine on a philosophy which would suit the atmosphere of such a regime. He expected his superior would understand its reasonings and fully approve. No, he knew Palpatine would. Such was their identical beliefs, he needed no reasoning for that.

Tarkin switched off the tactical update on the Death Star and proceeded out into the air of a planted-sized city. For a few seconds he took in the air-taxis, inhabitants and the shining buildings which crowded round his Imperial Quarters. To a man who could remember the days of the Republic he could certainly say that few changes had impacted the Coruscant skyline, save perhaps the presence of vast Imperial barriers adorning its gleaming walls. Even the Jedi Temple had been converted into something of a residence for his Sith Superior.

But Tarkin knew the greatest change across the capital of the Imperial Order. He could see it in the eyes of every man, woman and child he passed in the streets as he made his way to his personal Airtaxi, not some two blocks away, escorted by his own Stormtrooper squad.

Fear. Fear of death. Fear of their true feelings being revealed to those who might use it against them. Fear of loss of those they cared for. All of these things made them pretend the Empire was their protecter and ally.

Tarkin smiled inwardly. This single fact proved the idealogy he intended to embrace when the last strands of the Republic crumbled into dust would be ideal.

The doors to the airtaxi slit shut, there was some shuffling outside as Tarkin's personal chauffer entered it, already checked in Imperial Troops to not house any weapons which might be used to kill such a highly regarded officer of the Empire. He did not speak to Tarkin but rather steered the craft in the desired direction. Tarkin prefered that way.

He reviewed his morning in full. First to the Galactic Senate, where Palpatine would utilise his political powers to the most in expressing the danger of a newly formed threat to the Empire - a ragtag band of Rebels Tarkin barely thought glancing at. Then to the Imperial Residences for the far more significant discussion with his Emperor on the matter of his Regime Profile, including lunch. Then Tarkin would be shipped out to the highly secret Maw Installation to oversee the final completion of his long-awaited Prototype of the Death Star, started at the same time as the other on his own suggestion.

In what he expected would be about one week, he would prove his loyalty to the Empire and its Emperor's plans by overseeing the ultimate test of the Super-Laser he expected would be built into the Death Star's core.

Finished with his mental report Tarkin stared out of his Air-Taxi, content with his beliefs and expectations. In a matter of minutes, he would be at the Senate Chambers, where no doubt Vader would be waiting for him.
113.title: The Edict of a Madman

choices: wait patiently - and maybe look for something to do to help it along
114.content:
The young officer tried to fight down his nervousness as he waited for the secretary to call him into Admiral Thrawn's office. He also tried not to try to guess why he had been summoned. He found that that was not conducive to calm.

You, watching him on the camera from inside your office, couldn't know all that for sure. But you were fairly good at deducing such things from posture and body language. After all, the commander of the fleet of the Chiss Ascendancy had not been hard to fool, and the years had only honed the skills developed when you were young.

You decided you had watched him long enough and could put him out of his agony. You pressed the button, and a secretary told the boy he could enter.

You were sitting with your back to the door when he entered, but swiveled the seat around to face him. He stood stiffly at attention, still fighting with nervousness.

"No need to be nervous, Lieutenant." Your voice was calm, cultured, and smooth, any trace of accent carefully removed from it. By now your Basic, always good, was utterly flawless.

He seemed to relax slightly, though still at attention. "Sir?" he asked, trying to keep his voice expressionless. With anyone else, he might have succeeded, but such things did not slip by you easily.

You studied him carefully, as you have been doing for a long time. This boy had potential, and that was why he was here in your office today.

"I called you here to ask you a few questions," you told him. "Nothing to worry about," you added, as he looked frightened for a second, before hiding it. You paused for a moment, and the tension mounted in the room. Then you fired the missile. "What is the range of the tractor beam of a Star Destroyer?"

The question was elementary. Every midshipman knew that. Consequently he looked puzzled, but instead of answering, as everyone else did, when faced with that particular one, asked you another question of his own.

"Verdana- or Victory-class, sir?"

You smiled briefly. "Lieutenant Pellaeon, you have just been promoted to captain. The captain of this ship has your orders. Report to him immediately."

The look on his face was one of utter astonishment, but then he tried to regain his customary solemnity. "Thank you, sir," he said, with just a hint of excitement in his voice.

You fixed him with your eyes. "Always remember to keep in mind the past - and it's present possibilities."

He nodded. "Yes, sir."

"You may go."

When he was gone, you tapped the arm of your chair. Promotion. What every officer dreamed of. Midshipmen, lieutenants, captains, commodores. Even admirals.

When would it come to you?
114.title: Grand Admiral Thrawn - not yet Grand Admiral

choices: "If that is your wish, my Lord"
"I must decline.  I have other duties to attend to"
115.content:
Naboo was such a beautiful world, Admiral Zyas Tiers thought. It was two months after the birth of the Galactic Empire, led by Emperor Palentine (spelling?) and Darth Vader. The Emperor had gotten rid of the Two Thousand senators because they were "enemies of the state" or so the Emperor had said. Nobody wanted to argue with the Emperor, a Dark Lord of the Sith.
Admiral Zyas Tiers stood on the bridge of a Star Destoryer. The Empire had only made a handful of these large battle cruisers so far, but Zyas saw that the Empire would make countless of these ships. Since Zyas was commanding it, he got to name the Star Destoryer. He decided to call it "The Lynx" after an animal of his home world. It was nothing like the Lynx that we know. The Lynx that the Star Destoryer had been named after, was a 15-foot tall shaggy monster, much like a Wookie, but a tad stronger. Zyas Tiers was on a mission to Naboo. He had Darth Vader hinmself on board the ship. Vader discovered that his wife--Padme--was buried on Naboo, and he wanted to say goodbye for good. Also, Vader was to pick a governor to run the Naboo sector.
"Inform Lord Vader that we have arrived at Naboo" said Zyas to a junior officer.
"No need for that" came Darth Vader's voice. "I sensed that we were here"
Darth Vader was not a man to tangle with. If you can call Darth Vader a man. To Zyas Tiers, Vader looked like a hybrid of droid and human. Vader was more machine than man, that much was clear. Vader joined Zyas on the main deck and looked at Naboo floating in an endless sea of space.
"Make ready my shuttle" said Darth Vader. "I'll leave at once. Care to join me, Admiral?" If Zyas felt fear, he didn't show it. Zyas said..
115.title: Admiral Zyas

1151.content:
"If that´s your wish, my lord."
"Good, admiral."
Zyas only heard rumors about Lord Vader. He heard that he used to be a Jedi Knight until the day Palpatine declared Order 66: the anihiliation of the Jedi. His name was Anakin Skywalker, but his title as a Sith was Darth Vader. After a terrible accident on the volcanic planet of Mustafar, he had to wear this intimidating suit in order to survive.
Vader and Zyas went into the shuttle along with some stormtroopers in the hangar bay. Soon, the shuttle entered the orbit of Naboo and landed in the city of Theed. As Zyas and Vader left the shuttle, a very old man was walking towards them: governor Sio Bibble, an old friend of Padmé.
"Lord Vader, this is an unexpected pleasure, we are honored by your appearance."
"You may dispense with the pleasentries, governor. I´m here to see the grave of Senator Padmé Amidala."
Padmé...the woman Vader loved. The woman Lord Vader...killed? Zyas was not sure about that. But he felt for sure that something wasn´t right here on Naboo. And he was sure that Lord Vader, too, felt this. This journey to Naboo would be more dangerous than Zyas originally thought...
1151.title: Naboo

11511.content:
"Ah, the grave of Padme" said Sio Bibbel. "I will get a speeder for you, my Lord"
"Good" said Vader. "Admiral Tiers will pilot the speeder"
Zyas also heard that Anakin Skywalker was a podracer when he was a small boy. Zyas vaguely knew where Tatoonie was. The stories of Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi were legedary, so it would make sense that Zyas Tiers would hear about them. Before the Galactic Empire came to being, Zyas was a Captain on board one of the ships that defended Couruscant. He was one of the few who wasn't a clone.
Darth Vader and Zyas went to Theed Palace to wait for the speeder. People around the Palace stared at Vader, but Vader didn't notice. The two were followed by five stormtroopers.
It happened so quickly that Zyas barely had time to duck. Darth Vader ducked a half-second before Zyas did. Someone had shot at Darth Vader. The shot was aiming for Vader's head. Zyas scanned the area and didn't see where the shot had come from. The stormtroopers had thier blaster rifles out, ready for action.
"It came from above.." said Darth Vader, more to himself than to Zyas.
"Search the Palace!" barked Zyas to the stormtroopers.
Stormtroopers rushed into the palace, when Vader gave a command for them to stop.
"It came from a ship" said Darth Vader.
"Someone can't fire a blaster from a ship" said Zyas. "The chances of hitting something that far away is..."
"It would be no problem for a Jedi" said Darth Vader.
"J..Jedi?" asked Zyas. "I thought they were all wiped out"
"A few managed to get away" said Darth Vader. "My Master said that at least two Jedi are still out there somewhere"
Zyas didn't believe in The Force, as most people did. Everybody thought it was a hokey religion now.
"I will deal with the Jedi soon enough" said Vader. "our ride is here"
The speeder was made to carry four people. Zyas, Darth Vader and two stormtroopers took thier seats. Zyas was given a map to Padme's grave by the pilot that had brought the speeder. Zyas piloted the speeder off on its way.
11511.title: A Jedi here?

choices: Zyas is barging in with bad news
115111.content:
Soon, the speeder reached quite an impressive building; huge and beautiful: Padmé´s mausoleum (grave).
"Wait right there, admiral."
"Yes, my lord."
Vader went into the building alone, where he saw a coffin-like thing made out of stone before him.
Pictures from the past flipped before Vader, pictures from a happier past. He and Padmé on Naboo...with nothing to worry about. But Vader didn´t want to realize that it was his fault that everything went downhill. He blamed Obi-Wan for turning Padmé against him, for deforming him.
115111.title: Pictures from the past

choices: The Admiral and Vader's First Mission
1151112.content:
Vader stood at his wife's grave and thought about all the things that should have been. He had been deep in thought when he moved swiftly to the left as a person leapt down from above his light saber searing the top of the stone coffin. Anger filled Vader as he saw the desecration to his wife's coffin. Vader brought his own light saber to life and the sound of the saber's vibrated throughout the mausoleum.
The Admiral came to the doorway to find the source of the sound and at the sight of Vader and the young man stepped away. He knew not to interfere in any fights that Vader participated in or else his life would be in jeopardy too. He quietly went down the steps and rejoined the storm troopers not alerting them as to what was going on.
Vader stood across from the man. Vader knew this person but not as the person standing before him. Vader let the force flow through him. "Cotar, you were Master Zehn's padawan, correct?" Vader said matter of factly. The young man nodded. "My master sent me away before you came to the temple, knowing that I would be the last hope," the young man said with a certain amount of hatred in his voice. "You were still a youngling at the time and you have never finished your training, what makes you think you can defeat me!" Vader said sternly. The man lunged forward and Vader blocked him easily. The man fought bravely for nearly three minutes before Vader had him in pieces near the doorway. Vader reattached his weapon to his belt. Vader savored the victory for only a moment when he remembered his wife's coffin.
Vader stepped up to her coffin and saw that he could see her hand. Vader had not wanted to see her body. He wanted to remember her as the way she had been, but her hand still looked like a hand. Vader pushed the top off the grave, curiosity getting the better of him. He looked at the Padme's lifeless body. If he could have shed tears he would have. The coffin must have been sealed air tight because she had been nicely preserved. Vader reached his hand to hers. All the sensors in his hand told him he was touching her but it was not the same as touching her with real hands. Vader moved his hand to her stomach. Something wasn't right. Even if she wasn't decomposing at a normal rate, her belly should not still look like it was still full term. Vader ran his hand over her stomach. The firmness, the plain "feel" of it was not right.
Vader reached into the force. All he could see was a laser scapel and a baby crying. Vader knew at once that they all tricked him. Someone had performed surgery on her body and removed the child. Vader knew in that instant that his child with Padme was alive. Vader tried to sense whether he had a son or daughter, but the force was confusing him. It would not point him in the right direction. 'Someone was blocking him from knowing the truth.' Vader thought to himself. Just then Yoda's face came to mind (more so because he believed Yoda to be strong enough to block him than any other). 'Master Yoda is alive and has my child.' Vader thought to himself. Anger flooded through Vader's heart. He wanted to know where Yoda was, but the force would not show him and when he tried to sense the child he received conflicting images. Something was wrong. He knew he had to find Yoda and his child even if it took him two lifetimes, he would have what was his. Padme was taken from him, he would not let Yoda nor anyone else take his child. Vader knew the emperor must not know about this unless Vader saw a way to benefit himself. Vader lifted the case to Padme's coffin and put in back in place.
Vader left Naboo with a sorded sense of closure to Padme and a new fire had been lit his heart. His child was alive. As head of the Imperial Fleet, Vader could search many star systems. He knew that one day they would meet.
1151112.title: The Truth

11511122.content:
It was one week after Vader had left Naboo. Vader had mad contact with the emperor personally and asked to look for Master Yoda. Vader didn't say that he was looking for his child. The emperor granted Vader his wish.
"Where do we start looking, my lord?" asked Zyas Tiers, the Admiral of The Lynx.
"Master Yoda is somewhere remote" said Vader. "the force will not show me where he is"
"That narrows it down to 10,000 remote systems" said Zyas.
"We'll search every one if we have to" said Vader. Zyas said nothing but nodded.
"Sir," said a voice from the crew pit. It was Captain Osin, commander of The Lynx when Zyas wasn't on board.
"Yes?" answered Zyas.
"The closest remote system is the I'xanzine System" said Osin. "shall we start looking there?"
The I'xanzine System was indeed remote. It was only discovered about six months ago. The I'xanzine System is somewhat close to the Hoth System.
"Very well" said Vader. "set a course for the I'xanzine System"
Vader turned and went to his private quarters. He would find Master Yoda and his child.
11511122.title: The Search

115111222.content:
Vader stood on the bridge of The Lynx. The crew was silent as they ran scans on the planets in this system. Even the Admiral did not want to tell Vader that they would probably not find anything here. He sensed a change in Vader since Naboo and he wasn't sure it was a good change. He seemed to be more determined about something. He knew of Yoda through stories, that he was a very strong Jedi, but the Admiral wasn't quite so such that he was the one Vader was really searching for.
Vader swiftly turned around to Admiral Zyers. "Stop the ship and scans. We are heading down to the fourth planet." Vader hissed. The Admiral nodded in acknowledgement and gave the order along with the order to prepare Vader's shuttle. Vader looked at the Admiral intently. The Admiral knew he was expected to join Vader below on the planet. He didn't know what was down there, the scans haven't picked up anything in this system. He nodded to his second in command and followed Vader to the shuttle bay.
115111222.title: At the I'xanzine System

choices: stay with Medon and the Rebels
1151112221.content:
In the shuttle bay of I´xanzine IV. Lord Vader´s shuttle landed on a huge landing platform, surrounded by inhabitants of the planet, humanoids.
As Darth Vader went out of the shuttle, a group of people approached him, with a rather impressive man as their leader.
"Welcome, Lord Vader. I am the leader of this planet, Saesse Medon. What brings you to our remote sanctuary?"
"I am searching for a Jedi Master, and I do hope that you will cooperate, for your sake."
"There is no Jedi Master here on this planet, my lord. No one I am aware of."
"I will find out soon enough, Medon."
With these words, Vader and some of his stormtroopers left the landing platform, followed by Zyas, heading for I´xanzine City.
When Vader and his men left, Medon began to talk with his men.
"Do you think he is aware of the rebel-base here, master Medon?"
"No, I don´t think so. And we should pray he won´t find out. This base is essential for the survival of the Rebel Alliance. I will make contact with Senator Bail Organa and ask him what to do next."
"Master Medon...if there really is a Jedi left alive on this planet..."
"I´m sure there is no Jedi alive on this planet, as it would be too dangerous for him due to the existence of people here. But...Lord Vader should know that, so why else is he here?"
"Let´s hope he will leave soon without causing too much trouble..."
1151112221.title: Saesse Medon

11511122211.content:
Medon went to the control room to make contact but as he was about to attempt to contact Senator Organa he felt something and he knew that the starship above would be monitoring their transmissions. He needed another way to contact the Senator. He made a copy of all rebel plans and wiped them from the computer bank's memory. He took the disk and proceeded back to his quarters. Medon quickly found his daughter. Iolani was the light of his life. His wife had died a couple months after giving birth never having fully recovered. Iolani was only five and she was sitting on the floor in complete meditation her toys floating in the air near her. He never told anyone of her ability. He knew if the Jedi found out they would take her from him and since the Jedi were massacred he was more afraid for her safety. He hastily grabbed his daughter who cried out.
"Daddy!!"
"Sorry my child, some bad people are here and I need to get you out of here."
Iolani looked up at her father. Her grey eyes acknowledging his words. She was wise beyond her years. Medon knew that if Vader found her he would kill her.
"Lani, do you remember that nice man, Senator Organa." Medon asked of his daughter.
"Yes, he has a daughter too, Leia." Iolani smiled at ther father.
"Good, I need you to find him and give him this." Medon said handing his daughter a disk. She put the disk in her doll, which was looked like a small version of herself. "Child, if we do not survive Vader, please find a safe place to live." Medon said not knowing what else to say to her. He hugged her tightly and brushed her black hair back. She smiled at him almost as if this was just a drill and she would see him in a few hours. Medon took his daughter to a ship that was leaving to make a delivery to the Kossaver System.
Medon stepped back into the control room and sighed heavily as he saw the ship make it's way into hyperspace. Medon had the others make some sort of preparations. He didn't know what Vader was after but he knew that when Vader didn't find what he was after they would pay for it.
Vader strolled into the control room in great anger. He had sensed the force on this planet and when he felt it leave this planet he contacted 'The Lynx', they had allowed a simple freighter ship through on a routine delivery assignment. Vader was furious and wanted them to track the ship. Vader went into the control room and killed everyone except Medon, whom he had the pleasure of torturing. Medon died of strangulation before Vader could get any pertinent data, but he knew there was a spy in the Senate now. He knew that person had a lot of answers for Vader too. He didn't know when he would be back to Senate to find out that part of the truth, but Vader knew he had to tell the Emperor something. He knew he had to tell of the rebel force and they had a contact on Coruscant but Vader didn't tell him how high up it might be. 'Let the Emperor figure that out for himself' Vader thought.
11511122211.title: Plans

115111222111.content:
Lolani was five years old, but was wise as an old person. She knew--vaguely--where the Kossaver System was. The Kossaver System was quite near the Alderaan System, and was the vacation spot for the Organa family. Bail Organa was the leader of the Rebel Alliance, a group of people that were determined to destroy the evil Galactic Empire. The Rebel Alliance were few in numbers, but it was quickly growing. Lolani could foresee that the future was very cloudy indeed. Lolani sensed that the feared Darth Vader would put an end to the Emperor. Lolani didn't knew how Vader--as a member of the Empire--would destory the Emperor.
The captain of the freighter, Abis Mal, was an abled pilot. Lolani was quite impressed with Mal's piloting skills. Abis Mal's piloting skills could rival Darth Vader's. Lolani had heard that Darth Vader was a podracer in his younger days, and a prodigy for making things. Abis's sister, Yolana Mal, was also a member of the Rebel Alliance. Abis and Yolana came from Tavis V, a world destoryed by the evil Empire. Abis promised Lolani that he would protect her, even if it meant his life. Lolani giggled and hugged her doll closer to her.
After a 9-hour trip, the frieghter made it to the Kossaver System. Kossaver III was the freighter's destination.
115111222111.title: Kossaver

1151112221112.content:
Vader, Admiral Zyas and 'The Lynx' arrived at Kossaver III about two hours after Iolani was taken to Senator Bail Organa. Abis, Bail, and Iolani watched from the planet as Abis's sister and ship exploded. They knew instantly that the Imperial Fleet was here. Bail took Iolani in his arms. "Abis, you must go into hiding, they will hunt you down." Organa pleaded. Abis looked at little Iolani who was holding onto Bail. Bail nodded at him saying that he would protect her. "I will never be far away if you ever need me." Abis said to Iolani and disappeared into the nearby forest until it would be safe for him to leave. Bail took the child back to his quarters. Bail hoped to not run into Vader. He was supposedly on the Empire's side, so he could not run, to do so would look suspicious.
Vader and Admiral Zyas brought down a battalion of storm troopers to search the planet. It was Admiral Zyas who had the pleasure of meeting Senator Bail Organa. Vader had no interest in him, he was someone from his wife's past, besides he wanted the Jedi. He wasn't looking for a child when he should have been. Instead his search was for the man who used to captain the freighter ship.
"Senator Organa, it is a pleasure." Admiral Zyas said respectfully.
"Admiral, may I ask what is going on?" Bail asked hoping to learn some information. He didn't know if they knew how close they were to destroying the Alliance.
"Nothing to concern yourself with sir! We have everything under control." Admiral Zyas said trying to comfort the Senator. Admiral Zyas knew Senator Organa had never opposed the Emperor and so he had no reason not to trust him.
Bail knew the Admiral was not concerned with him and he released the breath he had been holding. They had no idea how close they were to ending it all. Just then Iolani came running into the room with a frightened look on her face. Bail picked her up immediately and tried to quiet her hoping that she wouldn't say anything that would give them away.
"Senator, I did not know you had another child. I only knew of the one." Admiral said quizzically. Bail didn't know what to say, how did he explain her to the Admiral. "Uncle Bail" Iolani said looking into his eyes. Bail knew how to explain her now and he looked into her knowing eyes. The force was with her, he had seen that look in so many Jedi. "Admiral this is my brother's daughter, Lani." Bail said. The Admiral didn't even question it. Bail's brother had died three years ago in battle. His brother had been married but his wife was a battle warrior from the planet Zenaria. They were a race of warriors that resembled humanoids but had catlike qualities to their features and abilities. That race was dying out rapidly thanks to Vader and the Imperial Fleet, but only Bail knew of his sister in laws true origins as no one had ever met her except for him. He could easily pass her off as his niece and he had a feeling Lani could help him. The Admiral nodded at Lani and Bail and bid them a good day as he needed to get back to the manhunt.
1151112221112.title: New Beginnings

11511122211121.content:
Bail was planning on leaving in the morning. He felt he had stayed long enough as to not cause suspicion. The Fleet had been combing the far side of the planet the past two days and Bail had barely relaxed the entire time.
Iolani had woken up in the middle of the night. She had another dream, it was about Leia again. Iolani knew her purpose, it was to protect her. She knew they would grow up together and be friends, but Iolani knew her true calling was to protect her. She was important to everything. Iolani felt there was much more to it, but she would not understand it until she had more life experience. Bail had told her about the Jedi Order and their way of life and what had happened to them all and that if they were not being hunted down that she would have been trained in the Jedi way. Iolani knew now why her father had always tried to keep her abilities a secret. Iolani was saddened by her father's death, she had felt it. Iolani was very connected to the force. Bail did not know how strongly she was connected to the force, but without proper training she would never know the true extent of her power or the fact that she could have rivalved Vader. Iolani knew that one day she would die protecting Leia, but she knew that she would be at peace because she would be saving her friend. She didn't know why sometimes when she was meditating and she thought of Leia she would suddenly have images of a boy in a desert. She didn't understand now, but she knew that one day she would. She was up early and joined Bail and his family on the ship as it left orbit and jumped into hyperspace.
Vader felt the sudden departure of the person that he felt the force so strongly in. He knew at once that the person he was looking for was not on this planet. He was angry at the incompetence of the people serving him. Admiral Zyas was lucky he was elsewhere at the moment. Vader returned to the ship with half the fleet and when the Captain on the Lynx had not followed through with Vader's request to track all ships and to not let anyone leave, Vader killed him instantly without waiting for an explanation. No one dared to offend Vader at the momemt. Vader called the rest of the fleet from the planet and the newly promoted Captain was given orders to track everyone down that had left. Admiral Zyas returned to the ship and wanted to say something to Vader for killing one of his crew but in fear for his own life said nothing.
11511122211121.title: Moving On

115111222111212.content:
Darth Vader knew there was a Jedi on Kossaver III, but it wasn't Master Yoda. The Jedi wasn't as strong as Yoda...or Vader himself. Vader had felt the Jedi leave when Bail Organa left the planet. Seems like there are more Jedi to hunt down. Vader contacted the Emperor and asked if he should go after Bail and the Jedi.
"Organa is no traitor to the Empire, Vader" said the emperor. "we'll hunt the Jedi on Alderaan soon enough. Now, continue your search for Master Yoda. If you don't find Master Yoda in 20 hours, head towards the Klaneo System"
"Yes, my Master" said Vader.
The Klaneo System was the site where a weapon was being built. A weapon the size of a small moon. A weapon that'll strike fear in the hearts of millions. A weapon which shall destory Alderaan in the near future. The Death Star.


Abis Mal considered himself lucky to still be alive. He hid in the forests of Kossaver III, armed only with a blaster. Abis killed several storm troopers, and was almost killed himself. When the Imperial fleet left, Abis came to Bail Organa's vacation home. Abis was nursed back to health by the household droid, C-3P0. C-3PO was accidently left behind by Bail.
"I'll return you to Alderaan" said Abis.
"Oh, sir! Thank you" said the droid.
Abis found a ship bound for Alderaan. Both he and C-3P0 would be on Alderaan soon.
115111222111212.title: The Search for Master Yoda continues

1151112221112121.content: Vader was starting to get angry and everyone tried to not make themselves noticeable to Vader. They did not want to be the one he took it out on. Vader was pacing on the bridge of the Lynx. He left Zyas to finish combing the planet. Vader knew it was pointless, the Jedi he had sensed was no longer there. Zyas finally made his way back to the ship with most of his troops. The Empire was leaving a small contingent of troopers behind to moniter the activity on this planet. Zyas reported to Vader what Vader already knew. They had no luck in finding the person they were after. Zyas was not one to be afraid of anyone but he had seen all the things Vader could do and Zyas had become a believer in the Force. Zyas lightly tugged at the collar of his uniform. He had seen Vader kill one of crew before without laying a hand on him and Zyas hated having to deliver bad news to him now. Zyas stood his ground and breathed a silent sigh of relief after Vader strode passed him without saying anything to him. Vader gave Admiral Zyas their destination and left the bridge.
1151112221112121.title: Where to?

11511122211121211.content:
The Klaneo System was a beehive with activity. The Death Star was a circle with no filling in it. The Death Star looked to be a cirlce of iron. Work crews worked around the clock on the Death Star, but The Death Star wouldn't be ready for three years. There was no way to speed up the construction either. The Death Star was unlike anything the Empire--or the galaxy--had seen before. 15 of the 20 Star Destoryers of the Galactic Empire was around the circle that was the Death Star. The Emperor had choosen The Imperial to be his flagship. All of the other Star Destoryers were designed like The Imperial*
Grand Moff Tarkin was the commander of The Imperial, and soon the commander of the Death Star. Tarkin and the Emperor were on The Imperial.
Vader took a shuttle to The Imperial. Admiral Zyas also went with Vader, not wanting to anger the Sith Lord.
"Ah, Darth Vader" said Tarkin when Vader entered the bridge of The Imperial. "Good news. The Death Star will be ready in two years"
"Don't be so pround of this terror" said Vader. "The power to destory a planet is nothing next to the power of the Force"
"As you say" said Tarkin.
Admiral Zyas, Vader, Tarkin and the Emperor looked out to see the Death Star. Two years. Two years and the most feared weapon of the Empire will be finished.
"Why did you order me here, Master?" asked Vader.
"I've heard reports of possible Jedi on Klaneo IV" said the emperor.
"Possible?" asked Zyas.
"Klaneo IV is hostile" said Tarkin to Zyas. "no human can survive on that planet. There's no oxygen. The atmosphere is mostly carbon dixode. However, we have picked up humanoid lifeforms from Klaneo IV. It may be a sensor malfuction, but the emperor wants to make sure there's no one to mess with the construction of the Death Star"
"Darth Vader will go down and search for any Jedi that are there" said the emperor. "it seems there is someone down there strong with the Force"
"Yes, My Master" said Vader.

115111222111212111.title: The shuttle to Klaneo IV

choices: attacks Darth Vader with 20 Jedi Padawans.
1151112221112121111.content:
Klaneo IV was a vast wasteland. The land was barren, rocks filled the landscape and the very soil was coppery. There was no water anywhere.
Darth Vader didn't know of any creature that could live in an enviroment so hostile..but, all things were possible in the big universe. Darth Vader had 10 clone troopers with him. Because of the war, the clones had been almost extinct. And Jango Fett was long-since dead. Someone had stolen Jango's DNA sample from the cloners. And Baba Fett didn't want to have a clone army of himself. Besides, nobody knew where the young bounty hunter was. Rumors had reached Vader that Baba had found work on a remote world called Tatooine.
Tatooine.
Nothing there but barren wasteland as well.
Finally, the small army came to a ship that had crashed on the planet. The ship was a Perry-Class barge, designed to transport mass amount of people to one planet to the other. Vader had once been in one of those transports with Padme, but this ship was even bigger than that transport had been. Darth Vader found a hatch and opened it, with some diffuculty. He could now sense the force within the transport. Yes. Someone was in there who had the Force on his side. The transport's system was still on-line. The distress beacon onboard the ship was of no use. Probably the crash took it out.
Vader sent the clone troopers on one side of the ship, and he the other. Vader was walking down a hallway that led to the cargo deck, when it happened. A boy around 20 leapt from nowhere and held a lightsaber. This young Jedi wasn't strong enough to defeat Vader, he quickly fell dead after a prolonged saber fight. The boy was an expert at saber duels.
Vader entered the cargo deck and inwardly gasped. The cargo deck was filled with children. Some children were Jedi, while others were not. There was a small town of children. A small voice inside Vader told leave the children alone. At least the Non-Jedi ones. He had killed younglings before. This would be no different. The Force was strong in the cargo deck....a little too strong to be coming from younglings.
When Vader came to what look like a town square, he was greeted by 20 Jedi younglings and a man in his mid-fifties. The man was so strong in the Force, Vader knew him to be a Jedi Master. All of the younglings were holding lightsabers.
"A-Anakin..." said the man.
"I am Darth Vader" said Vader flatly.
"Yes..a great pity" said the man.
"I don't remember seeing you at the Jedi Acamedy when I was there..." said Vader, more to himself.
"I left the Jedi Order three years ago" said the man. "I am Jizim"
"Jizim?" asked Vader. "ah, you were the one who went against Master Yoda's wishes...tell me, do you know where Master Yoda is?"
Jizim shook his head.
Vader could feel Jizim had the Dark Side in him. Just a tad. Just a pint.
"I suppose you want to kill me" said Vader. Jizim...
1151112221112121111.title: Shipfull of Children

11511122211121211112.content:
Jizim smiled, revealing a set of perfectly white teeth. "Ah, Anakin- Vader, that is. I had something slightly different in mind." He allowed his lightsaber to blink out of existence then. Vader was shocked. It would be a very simple matter now for him to strike Jizim dead where he stood and quickly slaughter the younglings. Yet he hesitated now. Jizim stood peacefully, his hands at his sides and pleasant look across his face, the force radiating from him like a beacon. Vader was not sure whether to consider his act one of contempt, considering Vader too young or inexperienced to even be a source of danger or one of respect, leaving his fate up to Vader to decide. He chose to believe the latter. Rumor of his immense power had surely circulated, Jizim knew full well what danger he faced.

Jizim was not fool though. "See," he commented, "perfect trust."

"Trust? You would do well not to trust me, I swear my alligence solely to the Emperor."

"As you should. As any Jedi must swear alligence to their master. Only the master has any true power." his words grated Vader and he knew it. "It was not you however I was referring to. Perfect trust in the Force."

Vader scoffed. "I see that although you left the side of Yoda you have not forgotten his foolish teachings."

"Right, you are." Jizim said, half-mocking Yoda's way of speaking. "I am no fool to disregard the wisdom of a great teacher. A great Jedi knows what knowledge is important and what can be disregarded as ignorance and does not ignore wise words simply because they came from a source that is not desirable."

"And you consider yourself a great Jedi?" Vader still held his lightsaber menacingly before him.

"I do." Jizim was still as calm as ever. "There is a balance between controlling the force and letting it control you. The Sith believe that they are the Forces master, the Jedi believe the the Force masters them. I believe neither." Vader was silent, Jizim could tell he was debating striking him dead right now. But he also knew that he had caught the young mans attention. He was hungry for Jizim's knowledge. This was good, the boy was not a complete fool then. "THe Force and I are equals. No master. We work together, we share our powers. Perfect trust."

Vader was taking in this theory, this class of thinking. No master. This Jizim was wise. But Vader knew he was being manipulated. Well, as long as he knew it there could be no harm in learning what Jizim had to teach, what Jizim had in plan considering he was still surrounded by a group of younglings. Vader could always kill him later. He allowed his lightsaber to blink from existence as well.

"Perfect trust." he intoned, "Tell me more."
11511122211121211112.title: Perfect Trust

12.title: The Rebel Alliance

121.content:
Leia had always wanted to be a senator since the time she went with her dad to an Imperial Senate hearing on Coruscant. She was only five years old at the time, but she knew Bail, her dad, was a highly respected member of the Senate, and she was proud to be his daughter. She had no memory of the Old Republic, or of her real parents. To her, Bail Organa was her father, and the Empire seemed to always have existed. Bail used to tell her stories, though, about the days of the Old Republic, stories about the daring feats of Jedi Masters like Yoda, Mace Windu, and especially Obi-Wan Kenobi, whom Bail has special high regard for. He never spoke of the mysterious padawan who turned on Master Kenobi, though she heard others speak about him. Whenever Bail was around, however, people suddenly went silent and spoke no more of this mysterious padawan. Leia often wondered what happened to that padawan, who seemed to have been a hero, and at the same time a villain. She had heard of Darth Vader, whom everyone feared even more than Emperor Palpatine, though she never made the connection of Vader to that mysterious padawan.

Leia attended the finest schools, and she aspired to the Senate like her dad. The stories of the Old Republic, and her father's constant efforts to organize a coalition against the Emperor's mysterious plans, gave Leia strength to pursue her own campaign. On the eve of her election, she swore an oath to herself to always do her best to fight for her people on Alderaan.

She appeared on the Imperial Senate floor on her first day as Senator Leia Organa of Alderaan. Her dream had finally come true.

"Who is that?" Leia asked her father, who stood next to her. She pointed at the topmost balcony.

"That is the Emperor."

"I've never seen him before," said Leia, staring at his dark robes. His face was hidden in the shadows of his hood.

"He doesn't come here often anymore. He has his followers who usually do his bidding. He comes only if something really important to him is happening."

"So, what's going on?" Leia asked.
121.title: Junior Senator

choices: While leaving the Senate, Bail and Leia meet Tarkin and Vader
1211.content:
Leia looked on the hooded figure of Emperor Palpatine, and she felt a sensation of fear. Yes, she might have heard great stories about him: he destroyed Count Dooku´s dangerous separatist movement, the Confederacy of Independent Systems, he dissolved the corrupt Republic and created the Galactic Empire, he got rid of the thread through the Jedi. But she was scared. She could feel that something wasn´t right about this man.
Everyone in the Senate Chamber went silent as Palpatine began to speak.
"My dear friends, you all know why I created the Galactic Empire. I wanted to bring justice and order to the galaxy, I wanted to get rid of corruption. And everyone in this chamber will admit that I succeeded. But, senators, there´s a movement that is threatening all we built: a movement that is just like the Confederacy of Independent Systems, a movement that wants to destroy our new order and bring anarchy over the galaxy. I speak about the Rebel Alliance!"
Some senators were outraged about the mention of the Rebel Alliance and began to shout something, but Leia didn´t listen. She looked at her father, and she knew that something was wrong. He sat in his senate pod without batting an eyelid.
"Order! Order!" Mas Amedda, a loyal follower of the Emperor shouted.
"My friends, this Rebel Alliance already attacked several important planets of our Empire. It is clear that we must act on this! We must destroy the Rebel Alliance in order to maintain peace and justice!"
"Peace and justice!" the senators shouted full of enthusiasm. Bail Organa shook his head. This reminded him of the day the Empire was created.
"Father, what´s wrong?"
"Leia, I...I´ll tell you later. There is something important you have to know.
1211.title: Palpatine´s speech

12111.content:
The senators still cheered at Palpatine´s words.
"Don´t they know what they´re cheering at?" Bail Organa whispered.
"Leia, let´s go."
"Yes, father."
Both left the senate chamber.
"Father, what did you want to tell me?"
"Leia, I..."
Before he could continue, he saw Grand Moff Tarkin and Darth Vader walking by. Tarkin is probably the most influential man in the Empire next to Palpatine. He is also a stunning commander who fought in the Clone War. It is said that he is currently involved in a mysterious new project only he and the Emperor know about right now. Little is known about Darth Vader on the other side. He is the leader of the Imperial Starfleet, a cunning warrior and pilot and Palpatine´s apprentice, yet Leia didn´t know what that meant. But no one knew who he really was and why he was wearing his intimidating black suit.
"Senator Organa! It´s a great pleasure to meet you here!"
"Thank you, governor Tarkin."
"And who might that little girl be?"
"That´s my daughter, Leia Organa."
"Ah, Leia. I am Grand Moff Tarkin. I´m pleased to finally meet you. And this here is Lord Darth Vader, my assistant."
Vader and Leia looked at each other, and both felt something that moment, yet they didn´t know what that feeling meant.
"Excuse me, governor, but my daughter and me have to leave now."
"Yes, Lord Vader and I have to leave, either. We have something important to talk about with the Emperor. So, if you´ll excuse us."
As the two imperial officers left, Bail seemed to be relieved. Their presence must have disturbed him.

choices: Obi-Wan takes a ship in Mos Eisley and flies to Jabiim
132.content:
Obi-Wan Kenobi. The legendary Jedi. Perhaps "the" Jedi. People in the galaxy knew Yoda for his wisdom or Mace Windu for his power. But Obi-Wan and his apprentice Anakin Skywalker became legends during the Clone Wars; heroes. Little did the people know of the events that broke Obi-Wan´s heart: the deaths of his Jedi friends, the betrayal of his best friend Anakin Skywalker, the downfall of the Republic and the death of Anakin. Although he survived the battle with Obi-Wan (he heard rumors on Tatooine about the Emperor´s "new" apprentice, Darth Vader, and he immediately knew it was Anakin rebuilt), Anakin was dead for him. He ceased to be Anakin Skywalker, he was consumed by Darth Vader, his inner Dark Side, the very evil he wanted to fight.
Obi-Wan had to go into exile because of the great Jedi purge of the Empire, and he chose Tatooine, a remote planet where the Empire has neither influence nor interest. He also went there in order to watch over a new hope: Anakin´s son, Luke Skywalker. He brought him here to his aunt and uncle, Beru and Owen Lars, good people. Owen was Anakin´s stepbrother, so it was the only family left for the boy. But he wasn´t alone all the time in his hut out there in the desert. He was able to communicate with his old master, Qui-Gon, who returned from the Netherworld of the force and received eternal life. Obi-Wan was learning this ability from his old master, and they were meditating together. But someday, something happened. While Obi-Wan went to Mos Eisley, he heard rumors about a group of Jedi who survived and who were now opposing the Empire; on the remote planet Jabiim.
"You want to help these Jedi, Obi-Wan?"
"Yes, Qui-Gon, I have to."
"But what about the child? Didn´t you swear to protect him?"
"I know...but if there are really some Jedi alive, I have to help them."
"I see...I admit that I would have done the same. Yes, you should go there, to Jabiim."
"Thank you, master."
"May the force be with you, Obi-Wan."
"May the force be with you, Qui-Gon."

13211.content:
The flight to Jabiim was without any interference. Fortunately, they didn´t encounter any imperial ship, thanks to Abis´ knowledge of star routes. It took about 4 standard hours to fly through hyperspace, until they finally reached Jabiim. A planet Obi-Wan knew too well.
"There it is, Ben: Jabiim. Doesn´t look too friendly." Abis said. And he was right. The surface of the planet foreshadowed what they were about to see: a world that has sunk into mud and blood, a world that has suffered from the Clone Wars like no other. Obi-Wan was once here, during the Clone War, together with Anakin. But he and Commander Alpha, an ARC-Trooper, had been captured by Asaj Ventress.
"Looks like there aren´t that many imperial bases on this planet. Who could blame them? It´s almost a dead world."
"Wait, let´s land there." Obi-Wan pointed with his finger on a point on the holographic map in the cockpit.
"Well, okay. I trust you."
It has been only a few months after the end of the clone war, but on this planet, another conflict already started, with the aid of some of his old friends, as Obi-Wan would find out soon.

Abis landed the ship near a swamp like environment. He and Obi-Wan left the shuttle in order to search for the Jedi.
"Fine, and how are we gonna find them?"
"Leave that to me."
"Oh well..."
After walking for quite some time through mud and other substances, Obi-Wan stopped.
"Wait."
He could feel the force here, around a person. And this person now appeared in front of Obi-Wan.
"Obi-Wan Kenobi! You survived!"
Obi-Wan knew this Jedi too well. He was about 25 years old and the former padawan of his friend, the female Jedi Siri. He left the order before he was knighted.
"Ferus Olin. I´m glad to see you alive."
"Why have you come here, Master Obi-Wan?"
"I should ask you the same question."
"Hm. I´ll bring you to the rebel base. I´ll explain you everything there."
"You´re in league with the rebels."
"Yes, but I´ll explain you later. And your friend here..."
"Oh, don´t worry. Abis is not a friend of the empire, he won´t betray us."
"Just as Ben said."

choices: the Empire attacks! Ben and the Jedi fight them!
1321111.content:
They finally reached the base. It was well hidden in the swamps, and it looked shabby, too.
A guard was now walking to Ferus.
"Sir Olin! Who are these people?"
"They´re friends. This here is master Jedi Obi-Wan Kenobi. And this here is Abis Mal."
"THE Obi-Wan Kenobi?! Incredible! I heard stories about you, and..."
"Parn, bring us to the conderence room, please."
"Yes sir!"
As they entered the base and were walking through it, Obi-Wan saw several rebels. They all seemed well trained in fighting, and they all seemed to have passion. Also, he had to admit that they were well equipped. Bail Organa and Mon Mothma did a good job in creating the Rebel Alliance.
They now arrived in the conference room.
"Well, I´m going to tell you now what happened."
Ferus sat down, sighing.
"You know that I left the order. After that, I was travelling all around the galaxy, until the day I heard about the massacre at the Jedi temple. I quickly went to Coruscant, hoping that I could save some survivors, and fortunately, I found some. Only 7, but there could still be more out there."
"And how did you come to Jabiim."
"We were attacked by an imperial ship over Jabiim, and we had to land on the surface. We were able to destroy our pursuers, and after some time, we met the rebels here. Some of them fought back then for the Separatists, but there are also some who fought for the Republic. The creation of the Empire seemed to bring the inhabitants of this planet together again after the Clone Wars. Looks like Alto Stratus was right back then..."
Alto Stratus...a highly respected member of the Confederacy of Independet Systems. On Jabiim, he was a hero for those who were opposing the Republic. And Obi-Wan fought against him. If he only had known Stratus was right all the time.
"Anyway, we decided to stay and help the rebels. The other 7 Jedi must be resting now. And...what´s this?!"

1321212.content:
Nobody moved aboard the Great Hope. Obi-Wan sat there, silently, waiting for what his old, foolish, traitor apprentice would do first. The pilot gestured to Obi-Wan that they had the opportunity to escape, but Obi-Wan quietly shook his head. He was waiting for a reunion with Anakin since the moment he left Mustafar fateful evening. He clenched his lightsaber which was fastened tightly in its sheath at his waist,

"Do what you must, Vader. I'm ready for you." he said to himself quietly.

Finally, on board the Star Destroyer, Vader made his move,

"Open fire!" he cried, in which his Imperial Pilots responded by firing their green laser beams at the small, rusty, old ship.

"Move right! Right!" Obi-Wan shouted, in which the Great Hope pilot swerved out of the way of the beams. The pilot then responded to the attacks by firing back, to no avail, sadly, because the Destroyer's shields were up. Obi-Wan cursed.

On board the Destroyer, Vader chuckled,

"I have you now, old man," he said quietly, turning to the soon-to-be-Starkiller, only a child at the time, who looked up at Vader, quivering in his small boots at Vader's frightening appearance and armor. Vader ignored his fear,

"Soon, WE shall have him, and the Jedi will be no more!"

Starkiller seemed to ignore Vader, but to keep staring deep into Vader's shaded eye armor, looking to see if there was sign of a man under the nightmarish suit. Vader looked off into space, in a daze, saying quietly,

"If only I knew were Yoda was..."

Vader was soon brought back to attention by his Imperial Pilots,

Sir! Our shields are up, and our cannons have locked onto them! Just give us your approval and we'll blast them out of space!" one of them said. But Vader ignored them, staring blankly off into space.

"I sense...another disturbance in the Force, a distant disturbance...one which I can barely feel, yet it is neither Obi-Wan nor Yoda...Who could it be?" Vader thought to himself. Little Vader knew that it was actually his own son Luke, living safely on the remote planet of Tatooine.

Meanwhile, back on the Great Hope, their useless attempts to bring down the Star Destroyer's shields were leading them nowhere.

"What should we do?!" Obi-Wan's pilot cried. "They've locked their laser cannons onto us! If we don't flee now then they'll blast us to smithereens!"

Suddenly the whole ship vibrated. Obi-Wan stumbled for a moment, nearly falling over, until the vibrations stopped.

"What was that?!" Obi-Wan asked.

"I...I don't know!" the pilot said nervously, pushing buttons and throwing switches left and right to see what was happening. Finally the pilot gasped in fear,

"Oh no! We're done for, now!"

"What is it?!" Obi-Wan asked, walking over to the pilot and peering over his shoulder.

"Th-They've l-locked us in an abduction ray! They're pulling the ship towards them! They're going to take up as prisoners!"

Obi-Wan drew his lightsaber, a brave look in his eye,

"Not if I have anything to say about it! Besides, I've been looking for a good battle!" he said boldly, "And a chance to speak with Anakin..." he said quietly to himself so nobody could hear but him.

"Hold on..." The pilot said, pushing more buttons and throwing more switches. "It seems we might have an opportunity to escape; their abduction beams aren't very strong!" he turned to Obi-Wan, "Do you want to try it? Or stay here and be abducted by the Empire and then try escaping heroically like all of you bold Jedi are?!"

1331111.content:
Sorry, I'm not sure what came over me there. That's not at all how the story went, so let me start from the begining here.

My name is Parn Veila, but my old Master called me Jake. Being easier to remember than "Parn Veila," the name quickly became what I was known by informally amoungst my peers. If not for the dog tags that I keep in my back pocket, barring that name, I myself may have forgotten it years ago. You see, that name is my only tie to any sort of family or heritage. When I was left on the steps of the Jedi Temple as a baby, I had nothing but the clothes on my back and those dog tags. As far as I'm concerned, I'm Jake now ("Master Veila" if you must be formal). I once asked my Master why he kept calling me that, he cryptically responded that I reminded him of an old Padawan he had....

My training was brutal, more physically and mentally taxing than the path of the average Jedi. By the time I hit puberty I was a master of 5 different lightsaber techniques and fluent in 7 others. Master Windu expressed great concern with the way that my Master trained me, but no action was ever taken to alter my training. By the time the Clone Wars rolled around, I was one of the Republic's greatest lesser known assets. My six foot four, 230 pound frame made me an imposing figure in combat, and I had essentially been bred for war before one had even broken out.

After years of service in battle, I was finally made a Jedi Knight. All of my trials were complete aside from the Trail Of Soul. My Master struck a deal similar to Obi-Wan Kenobi's win Anakin Skywalker's, and so the ceremony went on. Master Yoda knighted me under the condition that I would face a Trial Of The Soul.

I never did before the Jedi Temple was destroyed.

13311112.content:
Well I say infiltrating, but it wasn't so much infiltrating. Order 66 hadn't yet happened, and I was on my way back to the Jedi Temple following a month-long campaign against the Separatists in the Balmorra system. We'd heard rumours that they were constructing shipyards and planned to use the planetary system as a major staging post for future attacks on and invasions of Core World planets. To cut a long story short (because I'm getting off topic), myself, several other Jedi and two battalions of clone troopers managed to beat the separatists back, and many of them fled to Kashyyyk and Utapau.

Anyway, so I arrived back at the Jedi Temple, ready to relax after a month of warring. I entered into the temple and immediately caught sight of some old friend of mine: Dayle, Haila, Shem'mto, and Firnril. We had been younglings at the Academy together, and we always managed to remain close despite being assigned different masters and very rarely being able to gather together at the same time. I haven't seen any of them since that day... I told them that I was looking for Master Garn and they directed me to one of the youngling training rooms (which is probably what saved my life). As I walked toward the training room, I remember passing by Masters Windu, Fisto, Kolar, and Tiin who all seemed concerned and somewhat disturbed, though I paid little attention to it.

After several flights of stairs, and one brief stop to check the archives for any new information on Balmorra, I finally reached the training room. The door separating the room from the rest of the temple slid open automatically as I approached it. Inside I found dozens of younglings stood around socialising, but no Jedi watching over them. In all honesty, I think I would have been more concerned if they were practicing without a supervising Jedi present. I asked them if they had seen Master Garn and, right before they could answer, that was when it happened. The sound of blaster fire coupled with painful screams rang out, reaching as far as the training room where I had found the younglings. I told them to remain in the training room whilst I investigated. The door of the training room slid open once again as I stepped near it and I was immediately caught off-guard as a blue blaster bolt cut through the air and struck the wall directly to my right hand side. My feet carried me forward a few steps but the rest of me was in shock as I watched hundreds of clone troopers marching around the temple and shooting down Jedi masters, knights, padawans, and younglings alike.
"There's one!", a recognisable voice called out from my left hand side. I turned just in time to see two clone troopers with their rifles raised at me. Almost without thinking, I channelled the force through my hands and used it to pull my lightsaber from belt and into them. I activated and repositioned it infront of myself just in time to deflect the soldiers' subsequent blaster shots directly back at them. Each shot was reflected back into their respective chests, and I watched as the two troopers both crumpled to the ground, both sets of their armour then marked with black scorch marks. Confused, I returned to the training room and looked amongst the younglings who all looked fearful.
"The clones are attacking us! Tens of Jedi are already dead throughout the temple!", I exclaimed.
"What's going to happen?", one of the younglings, a small blue skinned Twi'lek girl, asked with tears beginning to form in her eyes.
"I am going to get us all to safety", I stated, which seemed to provide some of them with some form of relief.

The real question at the time was, how would I get them to safety?
13311112.title: A Trial of the Soul of Sorts
