141.content:
Boba Fett was quickly becoming a less awkward bounty hunter. Everytime he pursued a bounty, he thought of what his father had taught him before he died. Boba used these bounties as practice for the time when he could find and kill the last of the Jedi. He had heard that was the new empire's goal, as well. Good luck to them, he thought, but Boba had long ago decided that he wouldn't work for any one person exclusively.

Boba grinned as he came out of hyper-space near the planet Rigotous. His next target practice was rumored to be on this planet.
141.title: Boba Fett

1411.content:
Rigotous was a reletively barren and sparely populated world far out on the Outer Rim, ideal for any being trying to hide itself away from the universe and its dangers. Like Fett.

The Bounty Hunter landed his already infamous vessel, the Slave 1, in an out of the way valley somewhere to the North of the area he suspected he would find Kandus - a foolish pirate who had dared to smuggle larges piles of Rodian Salt Crystals, a rare spice craved for across the universe, from the clutches of his most regular sponser - Jabba the Hutt. Jabba had told Fett to find Kandus and bring him back to Tattoine - alive or dead.

Leaving his ship Fett activated a visual map of the area inside his helmet, the single real settlement on the planet some five miles to the South. Checking his weapons, the Bounty Hunter moved towards the place he hoped to find his prey...

###############################

Soon Fett reached what looked like a the local Cantinia, a grotty establishment which sat around several aged houses of grimey mud, a forboding set of mountains towering over this unsettleing scene. Fett wasn't concerned with the environment though, and he stepped into a smoked-patch room filled with the regular wide assortment of space-farers, cut-throats and Bounty Hunters like himself.

At the entry of such a familar figure, the whole room drew silent, save small whispers of "Its Boba Fett!" He stepped up to the Innkeeper, who tried to show any signs of composure on his fear-ridden brow.

"I'm here for Kandus Teht." the gruff and battle-scared voice of Boba Fett rang though his helmet's audio recepters as he spoke. "Something told me you know where he is."

"W-well, I couldn't possibily know-" The Barman stuttered to a halt as in a flash Fett stuck his trademark Blaster Rifle under his throat.

"I think you're mistaken. I'm not asking, I telling." The weapon moved further up to the Barman's sweat-stained forhead.

Without warning a huge shadow suddenly looned behind the Bounty Hunter. Stupid, he thought. The Barman has friends.

With expert precision Fett twirled to shoot a raging Wookie inbetween the eyes. At once its huge form slumped to the ground. The two other blaster-armed men behind him, one a Zamark and the other human, took a step back.

Fett returned to the Barman. "I don't like surprises. Kindly tell me where Kandus is, or you receive your friend's same order."

"He-He's somewhere in the Nureilous Valley, some kind of fortress, protected by a energy shield. Thats all I know, I swear!" The barman's heart was pumbing like a rabid wamp rat, but it calmed as Fett slowly lowered his weapon and walked out.

The night sky was making this pace bitterly cold, but the Bounty Hunter scarely noticed. He also failed to spot a short, squattish creature racing off to a nearby alley.

Nuere was a timid Bronian, but he had his orders from his master - if something came up what threatened Kandus, he would have to tell him about it...
1411.title: The Hunt Begins

choices: Strip off your armour and go after Kandus with your bare hands.
14111.content:
Fett surveyed the fortress with binoculars from atop a sand dune. The barkeep had been right, it was veyr well defended. Moreover, it was crawling like an ant hive. Spotlights illuminated the sky and automated turrets swiviled. Getting inside woulden't be easy...
On the plus side, the base's sensors probably would only register technology. Fett could sneak in with only his bare hands and go after Kandus...
14111.title: Fett finds the Fortress.

1412.content:
Well fett realized Han Solo is working with Chewbacca.

Later an ad. came "5,000,000 republic credits for whomever brings me Captin Solo's alive body"

Fett thinks two for one?
1412.title: His target is Chewbacca, the wookie

choices: how about some other bounty hunter?
143.content: Are you sure you want IG-88?
143.title: Hold Up

145.content: Do you still want Dengar or someone else?
145.title: some other bounty hunter?

1452.content:
Another famous bounty hunter than, or are you a new(er) face on the scene, ready to scour the galaxy clean of criminals?

Bossk, the Trandoshan weapons specialist and reknowed wookie hater, hunting slaves of the fledgeling empire from the pilot seat of the Hound's Tooth?

4-llom, the inhuman droid thief, allied with the exotic and unearthily skilled Gand hunter Zuckuss?

Or are you simply the infamous you, quite possibly the (third, hehe) most skilled of them all?
1452.title: Someone...Else.

choices: Something else develops (An imperial dreadnougt starts to jet towards you, etc.)
14523.content:
You step from the entrance way of one of the hide-outs of your latest employer, Gronda the Hutt, pleased to hace sucessfully completed another mission. Retreiving an expensive escaped slave and a treacherous smuggler had been far from the most challenging assignment you've recieved in your career, but the same ol' thrill shot throguh you. You fondly pat the small, universal scanning and recording in device in one of your non-descript cloak's many pockets, assured that many of the details of the smuggler Boss's HQ were now stored and ready to be downloaded to your ship's computer, without the hermaphrodite alien's know. After all, for all you knew your next job would be to accquire Gronda's big head. You never knew in this kind of business.

         You stride off down the street of the grimy, ill-looked after spaceport, avoiding eye-contact with the dozens of other shady characters, steering clear of the pick-pockets, and carefully but discreetly monitoring the pair of stormtroopers slowly marching down the streat on the opposing side from you, a trio of annoying Mark 4 Sentry Droids whirring along at shoulder height. You hury past them, heading for your ship, the Prey's Bane. Arriving at the simple, medium sized frieghter variety ship, you lovingly admire the hull, scored and pitted from all the time's the shields have failed and a few micro-meteors pinged into the hull, and several laser score marks from the odd dogfight with a persistant target.
But never where the two types of scars acquired at the same time, though. She might be old, ugly, and chalk full of parts not her own, or originally not from any kind of space-ship at all, but she had saved your neck a hundred times, had shocked and frustrated adversaires on a thousand occaisions, and was the only home you could possibly think off.

         You send the appropraiate code, and the ramp shudders down. Minutes later, you comfortably recline at the control seat, seeing the hundreds of stars of space stretching into the infinite, crystalline blackness in all directions. With the hyperspace engine running well, but with no target system to jump to yet, you bring up a hologrammatic screen, considering some of the options.

         A sizeable reward had been posted for the head of a mid-level imperial official by an unstated party, with the empire in turn offering a reward for information on whoever had posted it in the first place.

         One of the Hutt's might have a few people who's disappearence would be convenient or satisfying. The Underworld had been buzzing with rumours about an upcoming war between two prominent Hutt clans, which always offered plenty of work to the assassins, mercenaires, thugs, and killers of both groups.

         On the other hand, you had just gotten payed, and there was always sombody that somebody else wanted to have around, or nowhere around, maybe you should look for somehting else to do...
14523.title: Pick the prey...

choices: Look into getting some help first.
Just head over to whatever rock he works on and pick him up.
145231.content:
Yeah...That Imperial sound's just right. And I've never like the Empire very much anyhow. You think, lazily reclining in the Pilot's seat. "Ship, bring up any file we might happen to have on Inquisitorial Secretary James Matrek." There were several minute beeping and booping noises from the dashboard, and then a 3d picture of a large, solidly built man in a smart but austere imperial suit appeared, frowning at the camera, next to a short text. You carefully scan over it, looking for irregularities. He seems to be little more than your average office-working drone, even if the department he's attached to is infamous for doing some of the Empire's particularily dirty work. But nothing out of the ordinary that would make him seem like a target, certaintly nothing that would merit a reward this big... Oh, wait! His commanding officer, in fact, is none other than...

{indent{b}}Gravyl Hesk{/b}? You blink in surprise. There was a name that many in the new-born empire had coem to loathe and fear. Rumoured to have relations with the even more dreaded Admiral Willhuff Tarkin, he had been responsible for more shady cover ups, dissapearences, and surprising accidents of important-yet-tragically- vocal- folks than few other people in the Imperial Bureucracy.

         Hunh. That explained alot. Maybe a political rival was looking to bring down Hesk, and had figured that going through one of his secretarys might be useful. Or perhaps some other, underworld group was under fire from Inquisitor James' department, and was getting deperate enough to pay dearly for his head. It hardly mattered. All that was important was that someone had attached a monentary value to his life, or lack there-of, and that you'd be the one to cash in on it. But how to go about it?
145231.title: All done in the Name Of The Law- your law.

choices: the adventures of Han Solo and Chewbacca
the adventures of Jabba the Hutt
the adventures of some other smuggler
15.content: So, your story will focus on...
15.title: Smugglers and criminals

151.content:
Han Solo cursed under his breath. Those double-crossing smugglers. He was only a kid, but he knew when he was cheated. Signing up with this bunch was probably the stupidest thing he had done. Scratch that- the stupidest thing he ever did was actually trusting them, but joining them in the first place was a very close second.

Han paced around the small cell restlessly. Why would the Galactic Empire want a renegade kid, anyway? He wondered. New recruits? Very probable. Not that it would matter, Han had no intention of serving anybody. The only person he needed to look after was himself.

Han's musing and muttering was interrupted by the sound of the door being unlocked. A couple of stormtroopers appeared and shoved in...
151.title: Betrayed

1511.content:
The stormtroopers left Han and the hairy thing alone.
"What are you?" He asked. The thing just made a noise somewhere between a growl and a whine. "Whatever that means. Wait a minute, I saw a picture of something that looked like you in the bounty hunter's database. Chewbacca the Wookie." Chewbacca made a similar noise and nodded. "Okay then. Do you have any ideas how to get out of here?" Chewbacca shook his head sadly. "Alright, well, I'll think of something. Eventually."

They sat on the single bench in silence. Suddenly, there was a lot of noise like blaster-fire in the corridor. Han jumped to his feet as the door slid open.
1511.title: Chewbacca the Wookie

155.content:
The world of Tavis V.
Tavis V was a haven of smugglers and criminals. It had cities that would make Mos Eisley seem like Disneyland. Abis Mal was from one of those cities. Abis Mal came from a large city of Gaifounge on the Alarvi River. Abis was, in fact, the great-grandson of the governor of Tavis V, Tobias Mal. Abis Mal is a smuggler.
Abis Mal is not in Gaifounge now. He is running away from it in his YT-1300 craft (it looks like the Millenum Falcon). He was running from it because the city was now in flames. The new Galactic Empire had decided to hunt down all criminals and smugglers on Tavis V. He was also running away from the city because he had just killed two imperial officers, and he had no desire to stay and wait to get killed himself. Abis wasn't the only man on board The Glory Road. Yolana Mal was also there. Yolana is Abis's older sister. Yolana is also a smuggler. Yolana was piloting the Glory Road--which belonged to Abis--but Yolana was the better pilot. The empire was destorying Tavis V. Tavis V had refused to recongize the new Empire and the entire planet was suffering for it. Abis and Yolana Mal are orphans now. Thier parents had been killed by clone troopers commanded by two imperial officers. Abis and Yolana had killed the two officers and decided to run from Tavis V.
There were two Star Destoryers in orbit around Tavis V, but the Glory Road was nowhere near them now. That's how Abis and Yolana Mal got away from Tavis V before anyone could stop them. The Glory Road disappeared as it went to lightspeed.
155.title: Abis and Yolana Mal

choices: Arrive on Tantooine and search for Garner
Arrive on Tantooine and meet someone else
1551.content:
This is how Yolana and Abis's relationship is.

Abis sits in the swiveling chair beside Yolanda, his heavily booted feet up on the control board, his arms behind his head, humming some old tune popular in the seedy taverns on Tavis V. He looks to all the world as though is on some pleasure cruise. Not like he has just witnessed his parents die at the hands of imperial troopers, not as if he himself had just killed two men, not as if he had just escaped the total destruction of his home planet at the hands of the Empire.

To travel deeper then his physical appearance is not a dificult feat. He's not putting on some show of indifference. He's not actually drowning in a sea of despair and guilt and fear. He's wishing that he had a cigar. A nice fat cigar would do nicely right now. He keeps humming.

Yolanda is sitting rigidly in her seat beside Abis. She's stoutly trying to ignore him, she has never been good at this. She sees his uncaring posture, his stupid humming, she knows that his mind is probably lurking somewhere equally inappropriate. She knows her brother and is seriously considering stabbing his eye out at the moment.

Doesn't he care about anything?

There is so much that needs to be done. They need to decide where they are going to go, what they are going to do. They need to battle their inner-demons, they need to battle them now, this very moment or they will get stronger and eventually devour them. Yolanda knows that powerful emotions, once ignored, build fortresses within your own carefully built walls.

She is trying to come to terms with the death of her parents, of her planet, of her entire life as she once knew it. But damn that humming! She can't think!

"Get your feet off the control panel." she says, almost snaps at her brother. He does not respond.

"Feet off!" she picks them up and tosses them over the side. Abis does nothing. He's being unresponsive on purpose now just to annoy her. It's a game to him, they played it as children. Abis still had a miraculous way of making his older sister extremely pissed off. He felt that it kept her in her place.

"I can't believe you're pulling this bullshit at a time like this." she said in disgust.

"Relax." Abis said.

"Relax?" Yolanda almost laughed, the idea of relaxing now was perposturous.

"There's nothing we can do right now. Not til we get planetside."

"Abis we don't even know which planet we're going to."

"Sure we do."

"Oh, we do, do we? Well, it'd be nice if I knew which planet we're going to considering how I'm piloting the ship."

"There's only one logical place for us to go, my dear sister." he always called her that when he knew that he had though of something she had not, when he knew that he had the upper hand. He didn't have it long though. Yolanda knew where he was talking about immediately.

"Garner."

"Who else can we trust right now?"

"Alright, my dear brother." two could play this game. "Tantooine it is then."
1551.title: Where to?

15512.content:
Dust and sand flew up into the air as The Glory Road landed on the desert planet of Tantooine. Yolanda placed her pistol in the holster at her waist and opened the hatch.

"No playing around, okay? We find Garner and stay out of trouble-" Abis was already down the ramp and making his way to a seedy looking tavern across the way. "Right, of course he isn't listening." Yolanda muttered to herself. "Abis!"

Music and smoke filled the tavern and there were more then one who eyed the two of them with suspicioun or dislike as Abis made his way to the bar. This was nothing though, Yolanda was used to far worse on Tavis V.

"One crater shot." Abis ordered.

"We are not here to drink, Abis." Yolanda hissed.

"After what just happened, I think I deserve a drink." her brother responded.

"Oh yes, that's just what we need right now, impaired judgment, as though your judgment isn't impaired enough already." Yolanda leaned against the bar and rolled her eyes.

"Abis!?" a man in a dark brown tunic with an artificial eye came striding towards them. "Abis? Is that you?!" Abis spun around.

"Kraig!" The two men embraced.

"I thought it was you, I thought it was you!" Kraig laughed heartily. "Yolanda." he said with a nod of the head. Yolanda nodded in turn to the greeting. "So, what brings the two of you to a rock like this?"

"You won't believe-"

"That's none of your business." Yolanda cut her brother off.

"Still as fiesty as ever, I see." Kraig commented.

"She's a real bitch, truth be told." Abis said.

"Thanks for defending me." Yolanda said sarcastically.

"You? Needing defending? I'd never dream of it." Abis said and the two men laughed again.

"What do you say you come on back to my place?" Kraig offered. "I got some ale better then this dung."
15512.title: Crater Shot

choices: Abis and Yolana tell the sad story of Tavis V
There's a knock at the door....
155121.content:
Abis and Yolana argee to go with Kraig. Yolana sighed and walked out of the tavern with the two old friends.
Kraig Hirs was a friend of the Mal family for years. Kraig is also a smuggler. Some people might say that Kraig is the best pilot on Tatooine. Kraig moves from planet to planet, smuggling illegal goods for the right price. Kraig doesn't do buiness with the Galactic Empire though...even if the Empire wanted his help. Kraig and Abis were childhood friends who had a friendly rivalry with each of thier ships. The Glory Road has been said to be the fastest piece of junk in the galaxy. Kraig's ship, The Worthless Fool, is fast too. It was hard to say which ship was faster than the other.
Kraig, Abis and Yolana entered a hotel that looked as seedy as any hotel on Tavis V. Kraig, Abis and Yolana make it to Kraig's room. There, Kraig pulls out a couple of bottles from under the bed.
"I'm smuggling these babies to Mustafar" said Kraig, handing one bottle to Abis and Yolana. "got a hundred cases on board my ship"
"Jamelan Ale" said Abis, looking at the bottle. "you know if you get caught with this..."
"You know me, Abis" said Kraig. "I never get caught and I never will"
"What are you doing here on Tatooine, then?" asked Yolana.
"Gotta go to my employer and get paid before I go to Mustafar" said Kraig. "so...what brings you here, Abis?"
155121.title: Kraig's hotel room
